instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-0141: What is 820-0141? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.BKLT_EN: What is BKLT_EN? This signal enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKLT” before “_EN”. “BKLT” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0141</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight at power on. Sleep then wake and backlight
threads.message:
As in the title. 

There is no backlight at power on.
Once the MacBook has gone to sleep and is woken, the screen backlight works again. 

I don't want to remove the board as I think Apple should deal with this one. However, I'm not sure about the consumer law in the country of original purchase. 

Anyone seen this problem?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0141</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight at power on. Sleep then wake and backlight
threads.message:
Possibly issue with <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signals.
You should first try to see if machine is under warranty.
I will not be surprised of T2 issue...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0141</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight at power on. Sleep then wake and backlight
threads.message: That's exactly what I thought. I was wondering if anyone had seen this before?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0141</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight at power on. Sleep then wake and backlight
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 53610"]Possibly issue with <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signals.
You should first try to see if machine is under warranty.
I will not be surprised of T2 issue...[/QUOTE]

Ok, what I don't understand is how <SIGNAL>BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> can be there, but still no backlight. All other functions are working fine.
Sleep then wake and we have backlight. Restart we have no backlight until sleep / wake.... There must be a way t work around this.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0141</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight at power on. Sleep then wake and backlight
threads.message:
Did you try PRAM reset?
Also do SMC reset, if battery wasn't disconnected.
